description.narrative: Amount has been allocated for the youth program of 10,000 EUR, and will be granted to Sabeel for a youth initiative in East Jerusalem building on Wujood project.

participating-org.narrative:
Sabeel strategic plan is 2016-2020 and they are working on the new strategy 2021-2025. Sabeel strategy is mainly aligned with Oxfaminfluencing and advocacy program. Introduce Palestinian narrative for the Christian narrative. Bridging Palestinian and Christian communities to enhance Palestinians resilience capacities
The organization uses the #Audit# program as their accounting software , there is an annual audit for the organization , their last audit was for FY 2018 and was performed by Deloitte ,they have internal controls , but the internal controls are very proper since they are a small organization Bank accounts opened at the organization name , at Mercantile bank account , and they are at the process of opening a bank account at national banks if they got the Palestinianregistration. Their mission is to strive towards theological liberation through instilling the Christian faith in the daily lives of those who suffer under occupation, violence, injustice, and discrimination, their visionis that the local Christians inspired by the life and teaching of Jesus Christ stand for the oppressed, work for justice, engage in peace-building . General assembly, board of directors and executive committee. Executive team members and volunteers. Monitoring committee who reports directly to the Israeli government. Sabeel strategy aligns with Oxfam#s influencing and campaigning goals and strategy. It also aligns very well with Oxfam#s youth strategy, specifically in empowering youth to lead on advocacytowards their rights. The organization has no clear gender justice objectives. Sabeel has developed gender specific indicators for the program/project objectives and are these applied in the monitoring of interventions. the annual reports of the past2 years about the program/project contain sex-disaggregated data. women among the project participants fulfil leadership roles at all levels of governance. there are balanced female staff working in management or senior positions. There is no specific genderanalysis tools or policy.
as most of the organization#s funds are from private donations and the church , these donors will give the organization more independence and flexibility in meeting their vision and mission and goal as they are more flexible than other donors like SIDA , EU etc#. The project planning and monitoring are based on strategic plan. Communities and stakeholders are engaged in developing the action plan. The general assembly is responsible for the overall implementation and oversight. The board convene every two months, they monitor the executive staff and the progress. There isa program manager, Jerusalem committee who are volunteers (25 persons) support implementation and monitoring of the of the project. They have other8 committees. It takes a supervision and consultancy roles. For donor projects, the initiative developed by the youth participants from Oxfam#s project. It is in line with Sabeel#s mandate. Sabeel provide support and guidance on developing the project plan and monitoring process. Organization executive committee; three members - and the financial manager -Francis Tams are responsible for the donor reporting (both the narrative and the financial reports), after the reports are prepared by the project andthefinancial departments it is send to the executive committee at the two general assembly members to be reviewed and approved beforesharing with the donor. It is shared on social media and website. The projects budget are prepared as a team work betweenthe project staff and the finance staff , its review ed by the treasurer , it is submitted to the boar(financial committee) and approved by the general assembly. Total budget FY 2018 , 1,300,000 NIS , FY 2019 , 2,000,000 NIS , projects from this budget is around 100,000 Euro.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: Improved policies : # cases (sub)national governments or global actors adopting/implementing policies on quality and quantity of aid, as well as on ensuring rights and conditions for civil society to act as countervailing power to state & private sector

pieces of evidence or campaigns (documents, studies, videos, testimonies etc.) produced by Oxfam Novib and partners to support the adoption of new policy by the NL government on aid quanity (0.7%) and aid quality
